setAuthorisation(bytes32,address,bool).details: Sets or clears an authorisation. Authorisations are specific to the caller. Any account can set an authorisation for any name, but the authorisation that is checked will be that of the current owner of a name. Thus, transferring a name effectively clears any existing authorisations, and new authorisations can be set in advance of an ownership transfer if desired.

params.isAuthorised: True if the address should be authorised, or false if it should be deauthorised.
params.node: The name to change the authorisation on.
params.target: The address that is to be authorised or deauthorised.

params.signature: Signature signed by the node owner.

params.implementer: The address of a contract that implements this interface for this node.

params.name: The name to set.
params.signature: Signature signed by the node owner.

params.x: the X coordinate of the curve point for the public key.
params.y: the Y coordinate of the curve point for the public key.

params.y: the Y coordinate of the curve point for the public key.

params.value: The text data value to set.

params.key: The text data key to query.

ABI(bytes32,uint256).notice: Returns the ABI associated with an ENS node. Defined in EIP205.

addr(bytes32).notice: Returns the address associated with an ENS node.

contenthash(bytes32).notice: Returns the contenthash associated with an ENS node.

interfaceImplementer(bytes32,bytes4).notice: Returns the address of a contract that implements the specified interface for this name. If an implementer has not been set for this interfaceID and name, the resolver will query the contract at `addr()`. If `addr()` is set, a contract exists at that address, and that contract implements EIP168 and returns `true` for the specified interfaceID, its address will be returned.

name(bytes32).notice: Returns the name associated with an ENS node, for reverse records. Defined in EIP181.

pubkey(bytes32).notice: Returns the SECP256k1 public key associated with an ENS node. Defined in EIP 619.

setABI(bytes32,uint256,bytes).notice: Sets the ABI associated with an ENS node. Nodes may have one ABI of each content type. To remove an ABI, set it to the empty string.

setABIFor(bytes32,uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: Sets the ABI associated with an ENS node on behalf of someone. Nodes may have one ABI of each content type. To remove an ABI, set it to the empty string.

setAddr(bytes32,address).notice: Sets the address associated with an ENS node. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

setAddrFor(bytes32,address,bytes).notice: Sets the address associated with an ENS node on behalf of someone.

setContenthash(bytes32,bytes).notice: Sets the contenthash associated with an ENS node. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

setContenthashFor(bytes32,bytes,bytes).notice: Sets the contenthash associated with an ENS node on behalf of someone.

setInterface(bytes32,bytes4,address).notice: Sets an interface associated with a name. Setting the address to 0 restores the default behaviour of querying the contract at `addr()` for interface support.

setName(bytes32,string).notice: Sets the name associated with an ENS node, for reverse records. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

setNameFor(bytes32,string,bytes).notice: Sets the name associated with an ENS node, for reverse records on behalf of someone.

setPubkey(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Sets the SECP256k1 public key associated with an ENS node.

setPubkeyFor(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,byt.notice: Sets the SECP256k1 public key associated with an ENS node on behalf of someone.

setText(bytes32,string,string).notice: Sets the text data associated with an ENS node and key. May only be called by the owner of that node in the ENS registry.

setTextFor(bytes32,string,string,bytes).notice: Sets the text data associated with an ENS node and key on behalf of someone.

text(bytes32,string).notice: Returns the text data associated with an ENS node and key.
